Other Information.Additional Info: FK506 exhibited satisfactory linearity within the concentration range of 10−5 - 10−11 mol L−1, with a correlation coefficient (R2) of 0.9944, and the limit of detection (LOD) was as low as 6.4 pg mL−1.
The pore sizes of Au/Ag@ZIF-8 are 1.07 nm, which has a molecular sieving effect capable of selectively excluding interference from biomolecules like trypsin.
The pore sizes of Au/Ag@ZIF-8 are 1.07 nm, which has a molecular sieving effect capable of selectively excluding interference from biomolecules like HSA.
Despite being able to enter the pores, creatinine does not interfere due to charge repulsion with the positively charged surface of Au/Ag@ZIF-8.
Despite being able to enter the pores, bilirubin does not interfere due to charge repulsion with the positively charged surface of Au/Ag@ZIF-8.
Despite being able to enter the pores, uric acid does not interfere due to charge repulsion with the positively charged surface of Au/Ag@ZIF-8.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: LOD as low as 7.94 × 10−12 mol•L−1 (6.4 pg•mL−1)

Other Information.Additional Info: The dense network structure of ZIF-8 tetrahedral crystals enables molecular sieving of biomolecules, such as serum proteins, while simultaneously facilitating the interaction of target molecules with Au/AgNPs within the lattice, thus effectively circumventing the potential interference of biomolecules.
